name: Dynamic Side Hold
how_to_perform:
1. Start by standing with your feet hip-width apart, with one foot slightly in front of the other.

2. Bend your knees and hinge forward at the hips, lowering your torso until it's almost parallel to the ground.

3. Engage your core by pulling your belly button towards your spine, keeping your back flat throughout the movement.

4. Reach for the ground with your hand on the side of your body that is near the front foot, using your Serratus anterior and Obliques to stabilize your body.

5. Hold this position for a few seconds, maintaining control over your movements.

6. Quickly switch sides by reaching forward with the opposite hand and lowering your torso further onto that side.

7. Perform a series of rapid, alternating holds on each side, keeping your movements controlled and your core engaged throughout the exercise.
short_summary: Dynamic side hold is an upper body exercise that targets the Serratus anterior and Obliques while improving coordination and agility, as well as providing a full-body cardio workout
